1. Information related to the System and pertaining to a central bank may be disclosed after the written approval of the concerned central bank and through it.
2. Any information obtained from the System may be disclosed if such disclosure is in implementation of the provisions of the law or upon the request of a competent judicial authority.
6. Managing liquidity and financial guarantees in a way that serves the System's operation and ensures its continuity, in accordance with the terms, rules, and controls approved by the Custodians Committee <orig>لجنة الحافظين</orig>.
7. Establishing the necessary mechanisms to provide appropriate protection for cross-border transaction settlements, including the creation of a fund to guarantee these settlements.
8. Executing accepted payment orders for participants in accordance with the terms, rules, and controls approved by the Custodians Committee <orig>لجنة الحافظين</orig>.
9. Defining the conditions for current participants in the System.
10. Directly notifying the operator in case of default by any participant, in accordance with the terms, controls, and rules related to default approved by the Custodians Committee <orig>لجنة الحافظين</orig>.
11. Developing the necessary strategies to avoid risks in their various forms, in accordance with best international practices.
12. Developing diverse services related to the System.
13. Any other tasks or powers delegated by the Custodians Committee <orig>لجنة الحافظين</orig>.

### Article (9)
#### Dispute Resolution
The Council States <orig>دول المجلس</orig>, parties to this Agreement, shall work to settle any dispute arising between them concerning this Agreement through amicable means. In this regard, if settlement is not possible as stated above, the dispute shall be referred to arbitration in accordance with the arbitration rules agreed upon. If they do not agree on arbitration, the dispute shall be referred to the Economic Judicial Authority of the Gulf Cooperation Council <orig>مجلس التعاون لدول الخليج العربية</orig>.

### Article (6)
#### Eight Payment, Settlement, and Clearing
1. All payment, settlement, and clearing operations accepted through the System shall be considered valid, effective, and irrevocable for any reason.
2. Clearing arrangements shall be valid, binding, enforceable, and exempt from the provisions of bankruptcy laws in the Council States <orig>دول المجلس</orig>.

### Article (10)
#### Withdrawal from the Agreement
Any Council State <orig>دولة من دول المجلس</orig> party to this Agreement may withdraw from it, provided that it fulfills all requirements and meets all its obligations arising from its participation in the System.

### Article (7)
#### Immunities and Exemptions
1. The following provisions shall apply to companies established pursuant to Clause 5 of Article 5:
a- The funds and assets of the aforementioned companies in the Council States <orig>دول المجلس</orig> shall not be subject to nationalization, confiscation, or seizure, and may not be subject to receivership or attachment except in execution of a final judicial judgment issued by a competent judicial authority in any of the Council States <orig>دول المجلس</orig>.
b- The funds and financial operations of the aforementioned companies shall be exempt from any currency transfer restrictions that may be imposed by any of the Council States <orig>دول المجلس</orig>.
c- The members of the aforementioned companies, their funds, revenues, and operations authorized under this Agreement and their bylaws shall be exempt from taxes and fees of any kind in all Council States <orig>دول المجلس</orig> and from any legally imposed deductions in any of these states, with the exception of fees due for any services obtained by the companies from any public utility.
2. Members of the boards of companies established pursuant to Clause 1 of Article 5 of this Agreement and their employees shall be exempt from any taxes or fees on salaries or remunerations they receive from these companies, and their headquarters from the Council States <orig>دول المجلس</orig>, or residence in the host state, and other Council States <orig>دول المجلس</orig>, to enable them to perform their duties, all in accordance with the laws and regulations in force in each state.

### Article (11)
#### Termination or Suspension of a Party's Membership
The membership of any party to this Agreement may be terminated or suspended if it breaches any of its provisions or the System, provided that all other parties agree.

### Article (8)
#### Confidentiality of Information
All information exchanged between the participating parties in the System is considered confidential in nature and may not be disclosed or used except for the purposes of operating the System. The parties to this Agreement, the participants in the System, and its operator are committed to maintaining the confidentiality of information even after their withdrawal from this Agreement or the termination of their appointment as System operators or the suspension or termination of

### Article (12)
#### Interpretation
The Custodians Committee <orig>لجنة الحافظين</orig> shall be responsible for interpreting the provisions of this Agreement, and its decisions shall be binding.

### Article (13)
#### Amendment of the Agreement
This Agreement shall be amended by agreement of all signatory parties, and the effectiveness of the amendment shall be subject to the same procedures stipulated in Article (14) of this Agreement.

### Article (14)
#### Entry into Force
This Agreement shall be approved by the Supreme Council <orig>المجلس الأعلى</orig> and ratified by the Member States in accordance with the procedures followed in each Council State <orig>دولة من دول المجلس</orig>. The Agreement shall enter into force from the date of deposit of the second state's ratification instrument with the General Secretariat of the Gulf Cooperation Council <orig>الأمانة العامة لمجلس التعاون لدول الخليج العربية</orig>. It shall be implemented by the states that have ratified it.

# Decision of the Supreme Committee for the Verification of Kuwaiti Nationality <orig>اللجنة العليا لتحقيق الجنسية الكويتية</orig>
## No. (139 – 17) for the year 2025 AD
### Regarding the Loss of Kuwaiti Nationality
Having reviewed the Constitution,
And Article (10) of Amiri Decree No. 15 of 1959 <orig>المرسوم الأميري رقم 15 لسنة 1959م</orig>
regarding the Kuwaiti Nationality Law <orig>قانون الجنسية الكويتية</orig>, and its amending laws,
And after the approval of the Supreme Committee for the Verification of Kuwaiti Nationality <orig>اللجنة العليا لتحقيق الجنسية الكويتية</orig>,
We have decided the following:
### Article One
Kuwaiti nationality shall be lost by each of the following:

<table_caption>Individuals Losing Kuwaiti Nationality (Decision No. 139-17)</table_caption>
<table>
| No. | Name | Reference Number |
|:--|:------|:---|
| 1 | Fatima Ahmed Al-Sayed Ali Al-Sayed Ahmed Hassan Al-Qallaf <orig>فاطمة أحمد السيد علي السيد أحمد حسن القلاف</orig> | 105712096 |
| 2 | Samira Mohammed Abdulwahid Mohammed Turab <orig>سميره محمد عبدالواحد محمد تراب</orig> | 101816547 |
| 3 | Suhaila Mohammed Abdulwahid Mohammed Turab <orig>سهيله محمد عبدالواحد محمد تراب</orig> | 102299862 |
| 4 | Mawdhi Ali Jaber Hamad Shleel Al-Marri <orig>موضي علي جابر حمد شليل المرى</orig> | 105468470 |
</table>

This is based on Article (10) of Amiri Decree No. 15 of 1959 <orig>المرسوم الأميري رقم 15 لسنة 1959م</orig> referred to above.
### Article Two
The concerned authorities shall implement this decision, each within its jurisdiction, and it shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Those wishing to attend must send a letter indicating the names of attendees, their nationalities, and civil ID numbers to fax number (2221417), along with the company name and phone number, no later than the day before the preliminary meeting. Attendance at the meeting is restricted to companies that have purchased the tender document, with proof of purchase required. Bids are valid for a period of (90) days from the date of opening the envelopes. The initial guarantee amounts to (KD 8,701), and must be valid throughout the bid validity period and issued in the name of the General Secretariat of the Council of Ministers <orig>الأمانة العامة لمجلس الوزراء</orig>.

Please bring the following documents to obtain the tender document:
1.  Valid registration certificate with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.

3.  Valid national labor percentage fulfillment certificate.
4.  Authorization letter and a copy of the civil ID for the company representative to purchase the tender document.

For inquiries, please contact the Contracts and Tenders Control: Switchboard 1800008 – Ext. 2710. Inquiries can be sent to the email: m.altabtabaie@cmgs.gov.kw

## Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig>
### Announcement
### General Practice (D/A/A/79)

The Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> extends the closing date for submitting bids for General Practice No. (D/A/A/79) for insuring the Amiri Fleet aircraft to 18/9/2025. Companies or specialized institutions in this field listed on the Kuwait Stock Exchange <orig>سوق الكويت للأوراق المالية</orig> wishing to participate should apply to obtain the terms and conditions document and practice documents during official working hours from the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> at Bayan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> – Administrative Building – First Floor – Zone 7 – (Tenders and Follow-up Department <orig>إدارة المناقصات والمتابعة</orig>). This is during official working hours for a non-refundable fee of (KD 1000) only (cash payment only) for the document, starting from 8:30 AM until 1:00 PM, taking into account the following:
1.  Participation is restricted to local insurance companies qualified for this type of insurance.
2.  The final deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Thursday, 18/9/2025, and no bids will be accepted after this time.
3.  Bids must be submitted in a sealed envelope to the Tenders and Follow-up Department <orig>إدارة المناقصات والمتابعة</orig> – Bayan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> – Administrative Building – First Floor – Zone 7.
4.  Submission of an initial security deposit of (KD 11,500) only, eleven thousand five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars, in favor of the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> in the form of a letter of guarantee or a certified check from a Kuwaiti bank, valid throughout the bid validity period of (90) days.
5.  Submission of a valid national labor percentage fulfillment certificate.
6.  Authorization letter and a copy of the civil ID for the company representative to purchase the practice document.
7.  This practice is indivisible, and alternative offers are not permitted.
8.  The bid must remain valid for (90) days from the closing date, with the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> reserving the right to extend or renew this period for such duration(s) as it deems appropriate to complete the award procedures.

For inquiries, please contact:
*   Tel: 22011431
*   Email: fs.allaho@da.gov.kw

Undersecretary of the Amiri Diwan <orig>وكيل الديوان الأميري</orig>

# Announcement of Public Tenders

## General Instructions for Purchasing Tender Documents

*   The final time for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on the day specified in the above announcement for depositing bids.
*   Bidders and practitioners must adhere to the instructions regarding the submission and deposit of bids on the CD available on the Authority's website WWW.CAPT.GOV.KW.
*   The aforementioned cash payment must be made by certified check or K-Net card.
*   Companies / bidders wishing to submit inquiries, clarifications, etc., must submit them to the concerned entity at the time and place specified above in the schedule for the preliminary meeting (inquiry session). No attention will be given to any inquiries or clarifications submitted to the Authority.
*   All documents must be submitted on a non-copyable CD, except for the bid form and initial security, which must be submitted as hard copies.
*   Non-divisible.
*   A valid certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage, issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, must be submitted with the bid.
*   The bidder must attach a valid 'To Whom It May Concern' certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, stating that there is no suspension on the bidder's file regarding government contracts registered with the Authority due to any of the violations mentioned in Article 10 of Law No. 6 of 2010 concerning work in the private sector. Bids that do not include this certificate will be excluded.
*   This announcement serves as an invitation for interested bidders to attend, as interested companies have the right to attend the bid opening session.
*   Interested companies wishing to attend must coordinate with the Bid Opening Department <orig>قسم فض العطاءات</orig> before the specified date for the bid opening session and bring the following documents:
    1.  A copy of the Civil ID <orig>البطاقة المدنية</orig>.
    2.  A copy of the signature authorization for the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.
    3.  If someone other than the authorized signatory attends, a written letter from the authorized signatory at the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات</orig> must be presented, authorizing the attendee to be present at the session.
*   Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) are exempt from the fees for purchasing documents, in accordance with Article (39) of Law No. 74 of 2019 regarding amendments to Public Tenders Law No. 49 of 2016.
*   Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) wishing to apply for the tender must attach a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for SME Care and Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>, confirming their accreditation as a small or medium-sized project.
*   This announcement is considered an integral part of the tender documents.
*   For more information, please visit our website WWW.CAPT.GOV.KW.

- Companies / bidders wishing to submit inquiries or clarifications must adhere to submitting them to the concerned entity at the time and place specified above in the table for the preliminary meeting (inquiry session). No attention will be paid to any inquiries or clarifications submitted directly to the Agency.
- All documents must be submitted on a non-copyable CD, except for the bid form and initial security, which must be submitted as hard copies.
- Non-divisible.
- A valid certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage, issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, must be submitted with the bid.
- The bidder must attach a valid 'To Whom It May Concern' certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, stating that there is no suspension on the bidder's file regarding government contracts registered with the Authority due to any of the violations mentioned in Article 10 of Law No. 6 of 2010 concerning work in the private sector. Bids that do not include this certificate will be excluded.
- This announcement serves as an invitation for interested bidders to attend, as interested companies have the right to attend the bid opening session.

K) only fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and no more, non-refundable. Offers shall be submitted to the Purchasing Department at the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> inside sealed envelopes, accompanied by an initial security deposit of (2%) of the bid value (which must be valid throughout the tender validity period of 90 days). The tender number, as specified above, must be written on the outside, avoiding any mention of the bidder's name or any indication thereof. The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Thursday, 18/9/2025 AD.
*   The Ministry will hold a preliminary meeting on Sunday, 14/9/2025 AD, at 12:00 PM in the meeting hall of the Engineering Affairs Sector – formerly – Media Complex <orig>مجمع الإعلام</orig> – Al-Sour Street <orig>شارع السور</orig> – Ground Floor, to answer inquiries submitted regarding the tender. Anyone who has purchased the tender documents may attend the meeting in person or by a representative. Everything discussed in the meeting shall be considered an integral part of the tender documents and shall be binding on the bidders. The Ministry will circulate the questions, inquiries, and their approved responses to all bidders before the bid closing date.
*   All documents must be submitted on a non-copyable CD, in 3 copies, with the exception of (the tender form template, initial security deposit, a copy of the purchase receipt, and the bidder's data form).
*   The tender is indivisible, and alternative offers will not be accepted.
*   This announcement is an invitation for interested bidders to attend the envelope opening session, after coordination with the Purchasing Department prior to the specified date for the bid opening session.
*   A valid national labor fulfillment certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> must be submitted with the bid. Bids that do not include this certificate will be excluded.
*   The bidder must attach a valid "to whom it may concern" certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, stating that there is no suspension on the bidder's file regarding government contracts registered with the Authority due to any of the violations mentioned in Article 10 of Law No. 6 of 2010 concerning work in the private sector. Bids that do not include this certificate will be excluded.
*   Owners of small and medium enterprises are exempted from the prescribed fees for purchasing documents, in accordance with Article 39 of Law No. 74 of 2019 regarding amendments to Law No. 49 of 2016.
*   Owners of small and medium enterprises wishing to apply for the tender must attach a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Care and Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>, confirming their accreditation as a small or medium enterprise with the Fund.
*   This announcement is considered an integral part of the tender documents.
*   To obtain a copy, the bidder must register and pay the fees through the website: https://eservice.media.gov.kw/purchase

## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting of the Company as of
## July 15, 2025

The Extraordinary General Assembly of Al-Waha International Real Estate Projects Company (K.S.C.) Closed <orig>شركة الواحة الدولية للمشاريع العقارية (ش.م.ك) مقفلة</orig> under liquidation held its meeting on Sunday, 24/08/2025, at 11:30 AM, in Kuwait City – Sharq – Mubarak Al-Kabeer Street – ITS Tower – Plot 33 – Mezzanine Floor.

*   The meeting was chaired by Mr. Hamad Abdullah Al-Sanea <orig>حمد عبدالله الصانع</orig> in his capacity as Chairman of the Board of Directors and Liquidator.
*   The auditor, Mr. Khalid Mohammed Abdulaziz <orig>خالد محمد عبدالعزيز</orig> from Munira Abdul Latif Al-Majed Accountants and Lawyers – Experts and Certified <orig>مكتب منيرة عبداللطيف الماجد المحاسبون و قانونيون – خبراء ومعتمدون</orig>, attended.
*   Shareholders owning (10,000,000) shares, representing 100% of the company's total share capital, attended.
*   The Chairman of the Assembly opened the meeting in the name of God, welcoming the attendees, and then announced the availability of the legal quorum necessary for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting, as shareholders representing 100% of the company's total shares were present.
*   The items on the agenda were then read out for voting, and the shareholders proceeded to discuss the listed topics, where the following agenda was approved by unanimous attendance, representing 100% of the capital:
    *   Item One: Approval of the delisting of the company from the Ministry's records and authorizing the liquidator to complete the delisting procedures.
    *   Accordingly, the meeting concluded at 11:30 AM, and the minutes were closed at that time.

Chairman of the Board of Directors

# Burgan Company for Well Drilling, Trading and Maintenance (K.S.C.) Public <orig>شركة برقان لحفر الآبار والتجارة والصيانة (ش.م.ك) عامة</orig>
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting (Amended)

The Extraordinary General Assembly of Burgan Company for Well Drilling, Trading and Maintenance (K.S.C.) Public <orig>شركة برقان لحفر الآبار والتجارة والصيانة (ش.م.ك) عامة</orig> held its meeting on Sunday, 24/08/2025, at 1:00 PM, at the company's headquarters, Abdullah Building – Block 3 – Plot 78. The meeting was chaired by Mr. Mohammed Abdul Rahman Al-Mishaal <orig>محمد عبد الرحمن المشعل</orig> (Chairman of the Board of Directors). Also present at the meeting were:

*   Gentlemen/Kuwait Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للمقاصة</orig>.
*   Shareholders holding 77.651% with a total of (999,636,193) attending shares. After the announcement of the legal quorum for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting, the items on the agenda were presented, and the following took place:
*   The company's Extraordinary General Assembly reviewed the agenda and made the following decisions:
    *   Approval was given to amend Article (15) of the Articles of Association of Burgan Company for Well Drilling, Trading and Maintenance (K.S.C.) Public <orig>شركة برقان لحفر الآبار والتجارة والصيانة ش.م.ك. عامة</orig> as follows:

    **Text Before Amendment**: Chapter Two: Company Management (Board of Directors) as follows:
    *   A member of the Board of Directors must personally own, or the legal entity he represents must own, a number of shares whose value is not less than 7,500 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> or 1% of the capital, whichever is less. If the member, at the time of his election, does not own or represent this number of shares, he must acquire ownership within one month of his election, otherwise his membership shall be forfeited. The legal entity shall be responsible for the actions of its representatives towards the company, its creditors, and its shareholders.

    **After Amendment**: Chapter Two: Company Management (Board of Directors) as follows:
    *   1 – Must possess legal capacity.
    *   2 – Must not have been previously convicted of a felony with a custodial sentence, or a crime of bankruptcy due to negligence or fraud, or a crime against honor or trust, or a custodial sentence for violating the provisions of this law, unless his reputation has been restored.
    *   3 – Except for independent board members, must personally own, or the person he represents must own, a number of the company's shares.
    *   If a member of the Board of Directors loses any of the aforementioned conditions or other conditions stipulated in this law or other laws, his membership shall cease from the date of losing that condition.
    *   Approval was also given to amend Article (16) of the Articles of Association of Burgan Company for Well Drilling, Trading and Maintenance (K.S.C.) Public <orig>شركة برقان لحفر الآبار والتجارة والصيانة ش.م.ك. عامة</orig> as follows:

    **Text Before Amendment**: Chapter Two: Company Management (Board of Directors) as follows:
    *   The Chairman of the Board of Directors or any member of this Board may not have a direct or indirect interest in contracts and transactions concluded with or on behalf of the company, unless authorized by the General Assembly. None of them may participate in the management of a company similar to or competing with their company. The Chairman of the Board of Directors or any of its members – even if representing a legal entity – may not exploit information obtained by virtue of his position for his own benefit or the benefit of others, nor may he sell or buy company shares throughout his membership on the Board of Directors.

    **After Amendment**: Chapter Two: Company Management (Board of Directors) as follows:
    *   The Chairman of the Board of Directors or any member of this Board may not have a direct or indirect interest in contracts and transactions concluded with or on behalf of the company, unless authorized by the General Assembly. None of them may participate in the management of a company similar to or competing with their company. The Chairman of the Board of Directors or any of its members – even if representing a legal entity – may not exploit information obtained by virtue of his position for his own benefit or the benefit of others, nor may he sell or buy company shares throughout his membership on the Board of Directors.

At the end of the meeting, the Chairman of the Board thanked the attendees and concluded the meeting at 2:00 PM.

*   After obtaining the approval of the competent authorities.

Chairman of the Board of Directors

### KGL Real Estate Company (K.S.C.C.) <orig>شركة كي جي ال العقارية (ش.م.ك) مقفلة</orig>
#### Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
#### Held on 28/8/2025

The Extraordinary General Assembly of the shareholders of KGL Real Estate Company (K.S.C.C.) <orig>شركة كي جي ال العقارية (ش.م.ك) مقفلة</orig> held its meeting on Thursday, 28/8/2025 AD, at 11:30 AM in Shuwaikh Industrial Area <orig>الشويخ الصناعية</orig> – Block (A) – at the intersection of Al-Jahra Road <orig>طريق الجهراء</orig> with Al-Ghazali Bridge <orig>جسر الغزالي</orig> – opposite the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, and via remote visual and audio communication technology, chaired by Mr. Fadel Abdullah Al-Baghli <orig>فاضل عبدالله البغلي</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors, and attended by:
1- Mr. Ahmed Yousef Hussein <orig>أحمد يوسف حسين</orig> in his capacity as Board Secretary.
2- Ms. Rania Yousef Al-Nasser <orig>رانيا يوسف الناصر</orig>, representative of Gulf Securities Depository Company <orig>الشركة الخليجية لحفظ الأوراق المالية</orig>.
3- Shareholders by proxy representing (100%) of the company's total shares, amounting to 165,375,000 shares.
After the Chairman of the Assembly announced the completion of the legal quorum for the Extraordinary General Assembly, he opened the meeting, welcoming the attendees. The items on the agenda of the Extraordinary General Assembly were discussed item by item, and the Assembly unanimously adopted the following resolutions:
1- Approval of the amendment of the text of Article (2) of the Memorandum of Association and Article (1) of the Company's Articles of Association to become as follows:
Text before amendment:
A Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company named KGL Real Estate Company (Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company) <orig>شركة كي جي ال العقارية (شركة مساهمة كويتية مقفلة)</orig> was established in accordance with the provisions of the Commercial Companies Law and these Articles of Association between the shareholders whose provisions are specified hereinafter.
Text after amendment:
A Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company named Zood Al-Khaleej Real Estate Company (Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company) <orig>شركة زود الخليج العقارية (شركة مساهمة كويتية مقفلة)</orig> was established in accordance with the provisions of the Commercial Companies Law and these Articles of Association between the shareholders whose provisions are specified hereinafter (and its amendments to Law No. 1 of 2016).
These resolutions shall be subject to the approval of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> and other official authorities, and the completion of all publication procedures.
(The Extraordinary General Assembly concluded its meeting at 11:45 AM)

1- Mr. Fahad Fareed Bakkar <orig>فهد فريد بكار</orig>, Auditor from Roedl Middle East Office <orig>مكتب رودل الشرق الأوسط</orig>
2- Ms. Rania Yousef Al-Nasser <orig>رانيا يوسف الناصر</orig>, representative of Gulf Securities Depository Company <orig>الشركة الخليجية لحفظ الأوراق المالية</orig>
3- Ms. Samah Saeed Farraj <orig>سماح سعيد فراج</orig>, Secretary
After the Chairman of the session announced the completion of the legal quorum for the Extraordinary General Assembly, with the attendance of representatives of 100% of the shareholders registered in the company's books (17.5% in person and 82.5% by proxy).
Mr. Ziad Abdullah Abdul Aziz Al-Omar <orig>زياد عبد الله عبد العزيز العمر</orig> – Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors and Chairman of the Assembly, announced the opening of the session, welcoming the attendees:
The Chairman of the session immediately began to consider the agenda as follows:
**First:** Approval of the reduction of the company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital from KWD 1,000,000 (One Million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) to KWD 750,000 (Seven Hundred Fifty Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) by an amount of KWD 250,000 (Two Hundred Fifty Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) as surplus to requirements, provided that the amount is distributed to shareholders at 25% of the nominal value per share, totaling KWD 250,000 (Two Hundred Fifty Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) to shareholders, each according to their percentage on the date of the General Assembly meeting, with authorization for the Board of Directors to dispose of fractional shares, if any.
- The attendees ratified and approved this item.
**Second:** Approval of the amendment of Article Six of the Memorandum of Association and Article Five of the Company's Articles of Association as follows:
- Text before amendment: The company's capital was set at KWD 1,000,000 (One Million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) distributed over 10,000,000 shares (Ten Million Shares), each share at 100 fils, and all shares are cash shares.
- Text after amendment: The company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital was set at KWD 750,000 (Seven Hundred Fifty Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) distributed over 7,500,000 shares (Seven Million Five Hundred Thousand Shares), each share at 100 fils, and all shares are cash shares.
- The attendees ratified and approved this item.
The meeting concluded at 10:30 AM, and the Chairman of the Assembly concluded this session by expressing his thanks and appreciation on behalf of the Board of Directors.
Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors

Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting of Wa'eed <orig>واعيد</orig> Insurance Services Management Company held on Wednesday, 30/07/2025
The Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting of Wa'eed <orig>واعيد</orig> Insurance Services Management Company (K.S.C.C.) was held on Wednesday, 30/07/2025.
at 11:15 AM at the company's main headquarters, to discuss the agenda of the Extraordinary General Assembly, with the attendance of the following gentlemen:

<table>
| Mr. / Anwar Jawad Boukhamseen <orig>أنور جواد بوخمسين</orig> | Chairman of the Board of Directors and Chairman of the General Assembly. |
|:---|:---<p>The following is a list of activities that a company may engage in, along with their corresponding codes, as per the provided table:

1.  **662103**: Insurance management.
2.  **681091**: Ownership of real estate and movable assets for the benefit of the company.
3.  **642061**: Establishment of companies or participation with others to carry out company business.
4.  **649917**: Buying and selling shares and bonds for the company's account.
5.  **649918**: Investing financial surpluses in financial portfolios managed by specialized companies and entities.

These activities are part of the company's objectives, which also include:

*   Providing administrative and technical services to insurance companies for managing and organizing all types of insurance.
*   Assessing medical services provided by health insurance for healthy individuals.
*   Finding solutions to problems that may arise in providing insurance services appropriately.
*   Issuing special cards for policyholders to enable them to benefit from healthcare providers and contracted hospitals.
*   Settling claims arising from all types of insurance.
*   Paying claims on behalf of insurance companies.
*   Managing insurance programs approved by insurance companies.
*   Entering into agreements with service providers determined by insurance companies.
*   Preparing insurance programs provided for marketing or selling.
*   Establishing a network of third-party service providers for all types of insurance.
*   Utilizing the company's available financial surpluses by investing them in financial portfolios managed by specialized companies, and attending business meetings in Kuwait and abroad, whether as a principal or agent. The company may also engage in complementary or related activities for the aforementioned purposes.
*   Owning movable and immovable assets necessary to carry out its activities within the limits permitted by law.

The document also includes an announcement from the **Ministry of Education** regarding a re-tender for the utilization of four kiosk spaces for banks on the first floor of the Ministry's General Office in the South Surra area. They must also comply with the specified areas and conditions outlined in document number (5) and tender document number (1) for the year 2023 concerning government entities.

The meeting concluded at 11:30 AM on the same day.

### General Guidelines for Practitioners:
1. The practice is general for practitioners accredited by the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
2. It is a condition for anyone applying for this practice to be one of the specialized companies within Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig> in the works subject to the practice, registered in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig>, and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> for the current year, and to attach to their bid supporting certificates for this, provided that their date is contemporary with the date of issuing the practice.
3. This practice is indivisible, and the bidder is not entitled to submit alternative offers.
4. The financial cost for obtaining a copy of the practice documents is only (75) Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>د.ك</orig>.
5. The bid must be accompanied by a preliminary security deposit <orig>تأميناً أولياً</orig> of (2,000) two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> in favor of the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>. The preliminary security deposit shall be submitted by certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited by the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the bidder and in favor of the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, provided that this security is valid for the duration of the bid's validity. Any bid not accompanied by this security will be excluded. Preliminary security deposits may not be refunded until (90) days have passed from the closing date of the practice or when the winning practitioner submits the final security deposit and signs the contract, unless the practice is cancelled. The Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> will not pay any interest on the security deposit amount, and the practitioner holding the deposit is not permitted to seize its amount.
6. The total duration of the contract is (36) thirty-six months, during which the contractor is committed to executing the works of the practice, in accordance with the general conditions, terms, and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.
7. The bidder accepts that their bid remains valid and effective, irrevocable and non-withdrawable, from the time of its submission until the end of its validity period and the completion of the award. No price reduction will be considered after the bid's submission. The Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> has the right to request an extension of the bid's validity period until the date of final decision on the bids and the award of the practice.
8. If the practitioner, upon studying the practice, finds any error, deficiency, or discrepancy in the technical documents or in the bills of quantities that may affect the bid categories or its value, they must, before preparing and submitting their bid, clarify the matter in writing from the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>. The Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> will undertake to study these observations and inquiries, if raised, and answer them during the preliminary meeting (if any) or circulate the clarification and response by means of a letter addressed to each practitioner who purchased the practice documents. The response in this case is considered an integral part of those documents, and in all circumstances, this does not entail any additional responsibility or obligation on the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig>.
9. The practice documents shall be deposited in the bids box at the headquarters of the Supplies and Stores Department <orig>إدارة التوريدات والمخازن</orig> in South Subhan <orig>صبحان الجنوبي</orig> area during official working hours, no later than 15 working days. No bid received after the specified closing date will be accepted, nor will any modification to the submitted bid prices received thereafter be considered.
10. The practitioner must fill in the attached tables and provide a statement of all equipment and machinery necessary for the execution of the works – if any – within the same bid documents they submitted. The Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> has the right to reject the bid unless it includes the tables filled in accordance with the public interest, with the necessity of adhering to what is stated in the technical specifications and conditions of the practice.
11. The practitioner must submit all bank guarantees <orig>الكفالات المصرفية</orig> related to this practice in Arabic.
12. A meeting will be held

# Announcement

The Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> announces the offering of Practice No. P.M./S/17/2026 for maintenance work of the security surveillance camera system at Mubarak Hospital <orig>مستشفى مبارك</orig> and its surrounding buildings, and the health centers affiliated with Hawalli Health Zone <orig>منطقة حولي الصحية</orig>, among specialized companies in this field, in accordance with the general and special conditions outlined in the practice documents, which can be obtained from the Ministry's website (www.moh.gov.kw) for a non-refundable fee of (75 K.D.) seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only.

It is required to attach a letter from the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> when submitting the booklet, stating compliance with the National Labor Support Law <orig>قانون دعم العمالة الوطنية</orig> in accordance with Law No. 19 of 2000 and Cabinet Resolution No. 1104 (Fifth) of 2008 regarding the support and encouragement of national labor.

Please note that the closing date for the practice is at 1:00 PM on Monday, 29/09/2025, at the tenders box in the General Office of the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> (Sulaibikhat <orig>الصليبخات</orig> – Ministry of Health Building – First Floor – Procurement Department – Practices Section). Bids from tenderers are valid for (90) days from the closing date, and the initial guarantee is (2%) only of the bid value.

Note: Priority is given to owners of small and medium-sized enterprises affiliated with the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>.

Undersecretary of the Ministry of Health <orig>وكيل وزارة الصحة</orig>

Bids shall be placed in the tenders box at the Medical Stores Department <orig>إدارة المستودعات الطبية</orig>, and bids must be valid for (90 days) from the closing date.

Companies wishing to participate in the practice must meet the following conditions:

1- Local companies must be registered with the Medical Stores Department <orig>إدارة المستودعات الطبية</orig> in the suppliers' register.
2- Local companies must specialize in the medical field and be certified by an accredited certificate from the Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
3- When submitting two offers, two booklets must be purchased with different receipts.
4- Attach a valid product registration certificate from the Department of Registration and Control of Medical Drugs <orig>إدارة التسجيل ومراقبة الأدوية الطبية</orig> in the suppliers' register at the Medical Stores Department <orig>إدارة المستودعات الطبية</orig> as part of the bid contents (specific to drug control).

6- Attach a certificate of national labor support percentage.
7- Practice documents can be obtained from the Ministry of Health's <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> website.
8- The fee for purchasing the booklet can be paid through the website to be attached with the practice documents.
9- Submit price offers in a sealed envelope, including the practice documents, according to the closing date specified on the Ministry of Health's <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> website.

### Announcement

The Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> announces the tender for Practice No.: S/MS/42/2025/2026 for the supply of one small excellent wooden tea table and a 3-piece tea table set, in accordance with the general and special conditions outlined in the practice documents, which can be obtained from the Ministry's website (www.moh.gov.kw), upon payment of an amount of (75 K.D.) seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, non-refundable.
It is necessary to attach a letter from the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> with the submission of the booklet, stating compliance with the National Labor Support Law <orig>قانون دعم العمالة الوطنية</orig> in accordance with Law No. 19 of 2000 and Cabinet Resolution No. 1104/Fifth of 2008 regarding the support and encouragement of national labor.
Please note that the closing date for the practice is at 1:00 PM on Monday, 22/09/2025, at the tenders box in the General Diwan of the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> (Al-Sulaibikhat <orig>الصليبخات</orig> – Ministry of Health Building – First Floor – Procurement Department – Practices Section). Bids are valid for a period of (90) days from the closing date, and the initial guarantee is (2%) two percent only of the bid value, valid throughout the bid's validity period.
Note: Priority is given to owners of small and medium-sized enterprises affiliated with the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>.

### Announcement

The Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> (Medical Stores Department <orig>إدارة المستودعات الطبية</orig> – Drug Control <orig>مراقبة الأدوية</orig>) announces the following tenders:

The property is a private residence consisting of a ground floor, first floor, second floor, and a roof.
** According to the expert's report:
On 16/2/2024, we moved to the site in Al-Qusoor <orig>القصور</orig> area, block 3 - street 13 - plot 276, house 11, in the presence and guidance of the plaintiff's agent and in the presence of the fourth defendant from the second group (the remaining defendants were absent despite being aware of the scheduled appointment), and with the cooperation of Mr. Expert Al-Diraya / Salem Al-Shaqr <orig>سالم الشقر</orig>. The inspection was carried out as follows:
1. The subject property is agreed upon according to the general and specific specifications of document number 2019/7412, with a land area of 2400m² by virtue of a sale contract issued by the Government of Kuwait <orig>حكومة الكويت</orig> and issued by the Real Estate Registration Department <orig>إدارة التسجيل العقاري</orig>, submitted with the plaintiff's documents dated 29/10/2024.
2. The disputed property is a private residence, overlooking an internal street from one side and a courtyard used as a garden from the other side. It is also bordered by neighbors from the right and north, and has 3 entrances.
3. The air conditioning in the property is central, and it contains one staircase leading from the ground floor to the roof. The exterior is covered with white stone, and it consists of a ground floor, a first floor, a mezzanine, and a courtyard, with the following details:
    - Ground Floor: Consists of two halls, two bathrooms, washbasins, a kitchen, and two rooms.
    - First Floor: Consists of a distributor and 5 rooms and two bathrooms.
5. The first floor consists of 5 rooms + 3 bathrooms + a hall + two distributors.
6. The roof consists of 1 room + 1 bathroom + 2 storage rooms from the bridge.
7. The annex consists of 3 rooms + a kitchen + 2 bathrooms.
8. The Diwaniya <orig>الديوانية</orig> consists of two floors, each floor containing a room and a bathroom.
9. The courtyard surrounds the house and contains 5 palm trees..
4. The courtyard has a closed Diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig> which was not inspected by the expert. According to the claim of the fourth defendant from the second group, it consists of a room and a bathroom and is used by the first defendant, who still occupies it and holds the key. The courtyard also contains a room at the back with a bathroom for the former.
10. The air conditioning is split units.
11. The flooring is ceramic.
12. The lighting is normal.
13. The exterior cladding is from Spegma <orig>السبيجما</orig>.
14. The building condition is old.
Mr. Expert Al-Diraya <orig>الخبير الدراية</orig> recorded a preliminary review to estimate the value of the property subject of the lawsuit, including land, buildings, and aesthetics.

Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall start at the basic price. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Third: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, he must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, and the bidding shall be resumed at his expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was concluded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to him, unless someone comes forward in that session who accepts to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by depositing the auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be resumed in the same session based on this price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately resumed at his expense based on the price at which it was awarded to him in the previous session. No offer in this session shall be considered unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, the expenses of enforcement procedures amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement shall be published according to the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures shall be responsible for them, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Notice:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> according to Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, according to Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the expropriated owner was residing in the property, he shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obliged to draw up a lease contract in his favor at a fair market rent."
Deputy Chief Justice of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>

*Inspection:
The disputed property located in Jaber Al-Ali <orig>جابر العلي</orig> area - Block 6 - Street 28 - House 9 - Plot 47, bearing automated number 14068401. The inspection revealed the following:
The disputed property is a private residence with an area of 2,393.6 m2, conforming to the general and specific specifications of Document No. 2008/12815. It is located on an internal street from the back and a main street from the front (Al-Ghawas Street <orig>شارع الغوص</orig>). There is a side setback with a garden, and parking spaces on both the front and back sides. The exterior cladding is Jordanian stone, and part of the first floor is clad with Sigma. The house has (3) entrances, with one neighbor on one side. Air conditioning is split units. The construction is old.
The house consists of a half-basement + ground floor + first floor + half second floor.
The first defendant did not allow us to enter and inspect the property from the inside, but stated that it consists of:
Basement with a large hall.
Ground floor: Dining room <orig>مقلط</orig> + Diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig> + bathroom + washbasins + hall + main kitchen – preparatory kitchen – maid's room with its bathroom + storage room + bathroom.
First floor consists of: (2) apartments. Each apartment has a hall + (2) rooms + bathroom.
Half second floor consists of: one apartment with a hall + (2) rooms + bathroom.
The first defendant stated that the Diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig> floors are marble, while the rest of the house is ceramic. He also stated that he uses the property for residence, where he lives with his wife, children, mother, sister, and his sister's wife. He also stated that the property is not rented out and does not generate income.
Mr. Expert <orig>خبير الدراية</orig> took all necessary notes in preparation for valuing the property (land and construction).

In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.

No bid in this session will be considered unless accompanied by a full deposit of its value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property price.
Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to K.D. 200, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law and requires those directly involved in the sale procedures to act on their responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that he has inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.

Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall immediately be reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No bid in this session shall be considered valid unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting party shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, the expenses of the enforcement procedures amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal fees, lawyers' wages, and the cost of publishing the sale announcement in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for them, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the expropriated owner is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

Property Description: (According to the attached Certificate of Description <orig>شهادة الأوصاف</orig>)
Property Document No. (13512) (1999) located in Al-Riqqa <orig>الرقة</orig> area – Plot No. (152), Block No. (6) of Plan (27029 C), with an area of (400m2), by public auction with a base price of (300,000 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>) three hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
** According to the Certificate of Description <orig>شهادة الأوصاف</orig>, the following violations exist:
- Adherence to the main service street facade, and there is an unlicensed construction on the third floor with an area of approximately 170m2 and a part of the roof with an area of approximately 40m2.
** According to the Expert's Report <orig>تقرير الخبير</orig>:
The disputed property located in Al-Riqqa <orig>الرقة</orig> area, Block 6, Street 14, House 152, was inspected in the presence and guidance of the plaintiff personally, while the defendants failed to attend. The inspection was carried out as follows, in the presence of Mr. Sami Al-Tararwah <orig>سامي الطراروه</orig>, Expert of Knowledge <orig>خبير الدراية</orig> from the Department:
The property is a private residence located on two streets (front and back), one of which is the main street (Al-Riqqa Street <orig>شارع الرقة</orig>), with an area of 400 m2. The facades are yellow mosaic, and the air conditioning consists of split units, except for the main building's ground and first floors, which have window and split units. There is one elevator in the annex building.
The property consists of two parts:
1- Main Building of the Property: Consists of two floors, and the roof is covered with a large canopy <orig>سقف كبيري</orig> and used as a residential floor, as follows:
- Ground Floor: Consists of two halls, a kitchen, two bathrooms, a room, a storage room, a driver's room, and a bathroom.
- First Floor: Consists of five rooms and a bathroom.
- Second Floor (Roof Floor – large canopy <orig>سقف كبيري</orig>): Consists of three rooms, two bathrooms, a large hall, and a kitchen. This floor is served by a separate entrance and an elevator.
2- Annex Building of the Property: Consists of four floors, and the roof is covered with a large canopy <orig>سقف كبيري</orig> and used as apartment residences, as follows:
- Ground Floor: Consists of a diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig>, a dining room <orig>مقلط</orig>, a bathroom, washbasins, and an apartment consisting of a large room, a hall, a kitchen, and a bathroom.
- First Floor: Consists of two apartments. Each apartment consists of two rooms (one master with a bathroom), a hall, a kitchen, and a bathroom. The other apartment is identical.
- Second Floor: Consists of two apartments with the same components as the apartments on the first floor.
- Third Floor: Consists of two apartments with the same components as the apartments on the first floor.
- Fourth Floor (Roof Floor – large canopy <orig>سقف كبيري</orig>): Consists of an apartment containing three rooms, a bathroom, a kitchen, and a hall.
The experts found that the finishing of the main building is old, and the finishing of the annex building is in average condition.
The experts found that the facade cladding on the main and secondary streets is yellow mosaic, and it was also noted that, except for the roof floor, it is unclad black brick. A photo of the building was taken to be attached to the report.
The experts found, based on the plaintiff's statement, that the apartments in the annex building are independent and leased to others.
The plaintiff stated that the plaintiff and his mother (the first defendant) reside in the property subject of the lawsuit.

### The Disputed Property
*   The disputed property is an investment building overlooking one internal street from the front side. On the other lateral sides, the disputed property is bordered by neighbors (three neighbors). There is also an outdoor restaurant located on the ground floor, facing Mohammad Ma'arfi Street <orig>شارع محمد معرفي</orig>, named "Shawarma Factory <orig>شاورما فاكتوري</orig>".
    3- The repeated floors, from the third floor up to the nineteenth floor, each consist of (2) apartments. Each apartment comprises a living room + (3) bedrooms + (2) bathrooms + a kitchen.
*   The inspection revealed that the property subject of the lawsuit is leased to third parties.
*   The knowledge expert inspected the property subject of the lawsuit in preparation for estimating its value (land, construction, and total) and surveying it. He also reviewed the lawsuit file and its documents and recorded his observations in preparation for submitting his report on the matter.

** According to the description certificate:

## Property Description: (According to the attached description certificate)
Property document number 2007/1191 – located in Al-Daiya <orig>الدعية</orig> area – plot number 158 – block number 3 – from plan number 30295 – with an area of 487.5 m². This will be by public auction with a base price of (585,000 K.D.) (Five hundred and eighty-five thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
** According to the description certificate:
The property consists of a ground floor, first floor, and a roof – the property is in violation as there is an increase in the building area on the first floor and it does not conform to the property description in license number 59/3239 – there is an additional structure on the roof – there are no licensed plans in the technical file – the property violates the building regulations and systems of Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>.
** According to the expert's report:
- Inspection: The inspection of the property subject of the lawsuit was conducted on 24/9/2023, in the presence and guidance of the plaintiff's agent, the presence of the defendants' agent from the second to the ninth, and the third defendant personally, while the remaining defendants were absent despite proper notification, and in the presence of the expert, Mr. Salman Al-Bahwa <orig>سلمان البحوه</orig>, where the inspection was carried out as follows:
- The disputed property is a private residence plot in Al-Daiya <orig>الدعية</orig> area, block 3 – Abu Tammam <orig>أبو تمام</orig> Street – house 18, with an area of 478.5 m². The disputed property is a relatively old house consisting of a ground floor, first floor, and a roof, an internal corner location, external brick cladding, with 2 entrances, unit air conditioning, and tiled floors.
- The disputed property is used as bachelor accommodation, as the ground floor has 15 rooms, 4 bathrooms, and 3 kitchens. The side door has been closed and used as a room, and the garage is used as a room.
- The first floor has 13 rooms, 9 of which are large, 3 bathrooms, and kitchens with red finishes throughout the house. An additional structure has also been built in place of the courtyard in the middle.
- The rental value is 750 K.D. from 10/7/2021.
- The plaintiff submitted a portfolio of documents and stated that the quarter share was 1250 K.D. from before the deceased's death until the date of her death, and that the current rent of 750 K.D. received by the deceased defendant is not correct, and there is a discrepancy in the rental amounts, which are not fixed.
- The expert recorded his observations in preparation for estimating the value of the property and the quarter share.

The property is used as a family residence, and the third and sixth plaintiffs stated that the third plaintiff and the defendant currently reside in it, where the third plaintiff occupies an apartment on the second floor, and the defendant occupies a room with a bathroom on the first floor. The rest of the property is jointly used by all heirs. They also stated that the remaining heirs continued to reside in the property after the death of their predecessor for a period before moving out.

## Secondly: Auction Terms and Conditions:
Firstly: The auction starts with the base price, and participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees immediately upon the sale session.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, otherwise the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifthly: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding will be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid not accompanied by a full deposit of its value will be considered. The defaulting bidder will be liable for any reduction in the property's price.
Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, the execution procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventhly: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for it, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any ignorance.
Notice:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the dispossessed owner is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

Deputy Chief Justice of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>

** And according to what is stated in the attached expert report
1. The property subject of the dispute, located in Bayan area - Block 8 - Plot 182 - Avenue 6 - House 5 - Automated Number 12022485, where the inspection was carried out as follows:
1. The property subject of the dispute conforms in terms of general and specific specifications to document number 2015/2510 and has an area of 300 square meters.
2. The property subject of the dispute is a government house located on a street and an alley from the rear, with a front and back facade of beige Sigma, and has 2 entrances (an entrance from the street side and an entrance from the alley side).
3. The property subject of the dispute consists of a ground floor - first floor - roof, where each floor consists of:
- The ground floor consists of: a large hall with a dining table corner - 1 washbasin and bathroom - a kitchen with two doors (a door to the courtyard and an internal door to the hall) - 2 bedrooms - a guard's room with its bathroom and preparation area, and an external door to the alley.
- The first floor consists of: 2 master bedrooms with 2 bathrooms - 2 bedrooms.
- The roof consists of: a maid's room with its bathroom, also separate as a laundry room, and there are no other facilities.
4. The house's air conditioning consists of separate units - the floors are ceramic and parquet for the bedrooms - the decor is plain gypsum - the interior doors are wood - the windows are aluminum - the lighting is spot lights, LED, and dimmers.
5. There is one main staircase - there is no electric elevator - there is an electric shutter.
6. The expert found that the property is not rented, and the occupant of the property is the original defendant.
4. The expert inspection examined the property from the outside and found numbered apartment doors.
5. It became clear to the expert from the actual site that there are 2 basements, a ground floor, first, second, and a roof, which contradicts the certificate of descriptions issued by Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>. It also appears that one of the basements is residential and the other is for car parking.
6. The knowledgeable expert <orig>خبير الدراية</orig> took his necessary observations from the outside in preparation for estimating the value of the property (land and building) and the value of the quarter from the outside.
7. The expert inspection took photographs of the property subject of the dispute:
Secondly: Auction Conditions:
Firstly: The auction shall start with the basic price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit, at the time of the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, otherwise the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifthly: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was previously awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid not accompanied by a full deposit of its value shall be considered. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for transfer and registration of ownership, the expenses of enforcement procedures amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventhly: This announcement shall be published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures shall do so at their own responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the dispossessed owner is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obliged to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

- The disputed property <orig>عين النزاع</orig> located in Al-Qurain <orig>القرين</orig> area - Block 3 - Street 24 - House 16 - Plot 29, where the inspection was carried out as follows:
- The disputed property <orig>عين النزاع</orig> is a medium-built building consisting of a basement and 3.5 floors.

Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall start at the basic price indicated in the joint valuation decision. To participate in the auction, at least one-fifth of that price must be paid by a certified check from the drawee bank, or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks, or by depositing the amount with the Minors' Funds Department <orig>إدارة أموال القصر</orig>.
Second: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Third: If the bidder whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding shall be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session, and no bid in this session shall be considered unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder <orig>المزايد المتخلف</orig> shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.

According to the expert's report:
The property subject of the lawsuit, located in Al-Shuhada <orig>الشهداء</orig> area, Parcel (5), Street (509), House (1), Automated Number (15793365). The inspection was carried out as follows:
1- The disputed property matches the general and specific specifications of Document No. (5696).
2- The disputed property is a house located on an inner corner overlooking two streets, bordered by a neighbor from the opposite side and from the back side.
3- The property door was knocked several times, but no one opened it. Therefore, the property was inspected from the outside as follows:
- The disputed property consists of a ground floor, a first floor, and a roof.
- The disputed property has (3) entrances: a main entrance, a side entrance from the left, and a side entrance from the right.
- The disputed property has several shaded parking spaces.
- The cladding of the disputed property is Sigma.
Mr. Expert from the Administration <orig>خبير الدراية</orig> took the necessary notes in preparation for valuing the property.

Secondly: Auction Conditions:
Firstly: The auction shall start at the basic price specified for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Execution Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: The bidder whose bid is approved must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees immediately upon the conclusion of the sale session.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose bid is approved does not deposit the full price, he must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, otherwise the bidding shall be re-opened at his expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to him, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be re-opened in the same session based on this price.
Fifthly: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid with the ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately re-opened at his expense based on the price at which it was awarded to him in the previous session. In this session, no bid not accompanied by the deposit of its full value shall be considered. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees of ownership, the expenses of execution procedures amounting to K.D. 200, attorney's fees, expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventhly: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for it, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that he has inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance (i.e., a thorough inspection).

Notice:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the dispossessed owner is residing in the property, he shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obliged to draw up a lease contract in his favor at a fair market rent."

Firstly: The auction shall commence at the basic price associated with the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose offer was approved fails to deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding shall be reopened at their expense in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by depositing the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifthly: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session, and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense, based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No bid in this session shall be considered unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.

Warning: 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
