2. The property subject of the lawsuit is an old-finish residential plot with partial brick exterior cladding, and its area is 300 square meters, according to a sale contract document issued by the Government of Kuwait <orig>حكومة الكويت</orig> dated 4/9/1993, No. 164164.
3. The property subject of the lawsuit consists of a ground floor, first floor, and a half-floor on the second floor, according to the following details:
- The ground floor consists of a diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig>, a dining room (muqallat <orig>مقلط</orig>), a living room, 3 bathrooms, a kitchen, a storage room, and a courtyard.
- The first floor consists of two rooms and two suites, one consisting of a room, a living room, and a bathroom, and the other consisting of 3 rooms and a bathroom.
- The second floor consists of a living room, a room, a bathroom, a dressing room, and a kitchen.
4. The disputed property has an old finish level, with ceramic flooring, unit air conditioning system, suspended lighting, gypsum decorations, and ordinary painted walls.
Secondly: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall commence at the base price, and participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Third: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding shall be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session, and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No offer in this session shall be considered unless accompanied by the deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for transfer and registration of ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to K.D. 200, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement shall be published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures shall be responsible for it, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.
Notice:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose property has been expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

# Announcement of Real Estate Sale by Public Auction

The Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> announces the sale of the property described below by public auction on Thursday, 2/10/2025, in Hall 5 - on the eighth floor of the New Palace of Justice <orig>قصر العدل الجديد</orig> at 9:00 AM - in execution of the court judgment issued in lawsuit No. 2023/730 Sales/3, filed by: Nasser Ghazi Marzouq Al-Mutairi <orig>ناصر غازي مرزوق المطيري</orig>.

Against:
1- Ali Ghazi Marzouq Al-Mutairi <orig>علي غازي مرزوق المطيري</orig>.
2- Sanad Ghazi Marzouq Al-Mutairi <orig>سند غازي مرزوق المطيري</orig>.
3- Ghaziya Ghazi Marzouq Al-Mutairi <orig>غزية غازي مرزوق المطيري</orig>.
4- Husaissa Ghazi Marzouq Al-Mutairi <orig>حصيصة غازي مرزوق المطيري</orig>.
5- Hessa Ghazi Wasmi <orig>حصة غازي وسمي</orig>.
6- Fatima Ghazi Marzouq Al-Mutairi <orig>فاطمة غازي مرزوق المطيري</orig>.
7- Director of the Real Estate Registration Department <orig>إدارة التسجيل العقاري</orig> in his capacity.
8- Documentation Department <orig>إدارة التوثيقات</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.

First: Property Description: According to the attached description certificate.
- Property document No. 2022/6807 located in Al-Ardiya <orig>العارضية</orig> - Plot 186 - Block 2 - from plan No. M/31099 - with an area of 500 m2.
- **Note**: The name of the area has been changed from Al-Ardiya <orig>العارضية</orig> to Sabah Al-Nasser <orig>صباح الناصر</orig>, plan M/32738, a subdivision project within plan M/31099.
- **Note**: There are violations for creating an external door and exploiting the space for commercial activity (grocery store), violation report No. 14408.

**Inspection**:
The disputed property located in Sabah Al-Nasser <orig>صباح الناصر</orig> area - Block (2) - Street (9) - Plot (186) House (37) with automated number (13205734) was inspected as follows:
- The disputed property conforms in terms of general specifications to the sale contract issued by the Real Estate Registration and Documentation Department <orig>إدارة التسجيل العقاري والتوثيق</orig> No. (5802) dated 20/10/1984 and with an area of 2500 m2.
- The disputed property is a house located on two streets (front and back), an internal street numbered (9) and a main street numbered (101), bordered by a neighbor on two sides and with a frontage of (20)m.
- The disputed property contains (6) entrances.
- The disputed property consists of a basement, ground floor, first floor, roof, and a courtyard with an annex.
- The first defendant guided to the components of the property, which are as follows:
1- The basement consists of a diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig> and car parking.
2- The ground floor consists of an external kitchen + hall + bathroom and washbasins + (3) bedrooms + diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig> + external room.
3- The first floor consists of (6) rooms + hall + (3) bathrooms.
4- The roof consists of a machinery room.

**As stated in the Description Certificate**:
- That the property is a private residence consisting of a ground floor + first floor + part of the second floor, and there is an unlicensed building on the street side with an area of 50 m2, and there is a staircase leading to the first floor on the street side, and there is an unlicensed building on the first floor on the street side of 60 m2, and on the service street side and neighbor's side with an area of 50 m2, and on the second floor there is an unlicensed building with an area of 40 m2 and a canopy <orig>كبيري</orig> of 20 m2.

**And according to the expert's report**:
- The property subject of the lawsuit located in Al-Riqqa <orig>الرقة</orig> area, Block 1, Street 30, Plot 414, in the presence and guidance of the second plaintiff personally, Mr. Waleed Zaid Rashid Makshah <orig>وليد زيد راشد مكشح</orig>, holding Civil ID No. (272122800953), and the inspection was carried out as follows:
- The property subject of the lawsuit is a government house conforming to the general and specific specifications of document No. 1992/7673 and with an area of 400 m2.
- The property subject of the lawsuit is located on two streets (front and back), Street No. 30 and 10, and is bordered by a neighbor on two sides.
- The property subject of the lawsuit consists of a ground floor + first floor + roof, with the following details:
- The ground floor consists of: an external diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig> + bathroom and washbasins + entrance distributor - kitchen - (2) halls + living room, (2) bathrooms with washbasins.
- The first floor consists of two apartments:
- Apartment No. 1 consists of a hall - (2) rooms + bathroom + master bedroom + maid's room, kitchen. The apartment also has a private entrance from the rear facade of the property, where there is a staircase serving the apartment.
- Apartment No. 2 consists of (2) rooms + bathroom + storage room and has two entrances from inside the property.
- The roof consists of: a maid's room + bathroom + storage room + bathroom from the canopy <orig>الكبريي</orig> - storage room.
- There is one internal staircase serving all floors and one external staircase located on the rear facade serving Apartment No. 1. There are 4 entrances, two from each facade.
- The property is an old house consisting of separate units and the exterior cladding is Sigma <orig>السيجما</orig>.
- The second plaintiff stated that he occupies the property with his family, and his mother, the first defendant, shares a part of the property with him.

Second: Auction Terms:
First: The auction shall commence at the basic price of the property, and participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit, at the time of the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Third: If the approved bidder does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, otherwise the bidding shall be resumed in the same session based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits in the session following the auction award, unless someone comes forward in that session who accepts to purchase with a ten percent increase calculated by depositing the full price, in which case the bidding shall be resumed in the same session based on this price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall immediately be resumed at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session, and no bid in this session shall be considered unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any decrease in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the transfer and registration fees of ownership, the expenses of enforcement procedures amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures request it at their own responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.

Firstly: Property Description:
- Document No. 6001/2019 located in Salwa <orig>سلوى</orig> area - Plot No. 132 - Block No. 5 - from Plan No. 33778/M - with an area of 750m² for an amount of 460,583 K.D. (Four hundred sixty thousand five hundred eighty-three Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
- According to the description certificate,
- The property is a private residence consisting of a basement + ground floor + first floor + second floor and a roof.
- And according to the expert's report,
- The disputed property is located in Salwa <orig>سلوى</orig> area - Block 5 - Street 4 - House 3 - Plot 132 - with an area of 750 m² - according to Document No. 6001 dated 3/6/2019.
- The disputed property is located on a single street and is bordered on the right and left by two neighboring private residences.
- The disputed property consists of a basement, ground floor, first floor, second floor, and a roof, with the following details:
1- The basement consists of parking spaces accommodating 14 vehicles, and there is an apartment consisting of 3 rooms, one of which is a master bedroom with its private bathroom, a kitchen, a bathroom, and a maid's room with its private bathroom, according to the plaintiff's statement, as the expert was unable to inspect it due to not being granted access to the apartment.
There are also very small rooms in the basement with 'karbi' <orig>كربي</orig> walls that were used as storage rooms.
2- The ground floor consists of 3 identical apartments in terms of the number of rooms, living areas, bathrooms, and kitchens, according to the plaintiff's statement. The expert and the study expert inspected apartment No. (3), which is owned by the plaintiff and the fourth defendant, Homs and Yazid <orig>حمص ويزيد</orig>. The apartment consists of a living room, a master bedroom with its private bathroom, two rooms with a shared bathroom, a guest bathroom, a kitchen, and a maid's room with its private bathroom. The apartment's floor finishing is ceramic.
The expert was unable to inspect the remaining apartments on this floor due to not being granted access.
3- The first floor consists of 3 identical apartments in terms of the number of rooms, living areas, bathrooms, and kitchens, according to the plaintiff's statement. The expert inspected apartment No. (5), owned by the second defendant, which consists of a living room, a master bedroom with its private bathroom, two rooms with a shared bathroom, a kitchen, and a maid's room with a kitchen. The expert was unable to inspect the remaining apartments due to not being granted access.
4- The second floor consists of 3 identical apartments in terms of the number of rooms, living areas, bathrooms, and kitchens, according to the plaintiff's statement. The expert was unable to inspect them due to not being granted access.
5- The roof of the disputed property consists of a staircase house, an elevator, an air conditioning area, and rooms made of 'kubri' <orig>كبري</orig> that were constructed by the residents of the property, according to the plaintiff's statement, as the expert was unable to inspect the roof.
- The exterior cladding of the property subject to the lawsuit is Sigma.
- The air conditioning of the disputed property is central air conditioning.
- The property has an electric elevator.

- The annex is a rented grocery store.
- The air conditioning of the disputed property is central.
- The exterior cladding is beige stone.
- The study expert inspected the property in preparation for estimating its value and submitting a report thereon, and also reviewed the case file and its documents.

Secondly: Auction Terms:
Firstly: The auction shall commence with a base price of 360,855 K.D. (Three hundred sixty thousand eight hundred fifty-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of the price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose offer was approved fails to deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, otherwise, the bidding shall be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. This announcement is made in application of the law and as a request for bids for the sale procedures, and at their responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Fifthly: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall immediately be reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session, and no offer in this session shall be considered unless accompanied by the deposit of its full value.
The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventhly: This announcement is published in application of the law and as a request for bids for the sale procedures, and at their responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose ownership was dispossessed is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

# Announcement of Real Estate Sale by Public Auction

The Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> announces the sale of the property described below by public auction on Wednesday, 1/10/2025, in Hall 5 on the eighth floor of the New Palace of Justice <orig>قصر العدل الجديد</orig> at 7:00 AM, in execution of the court judgment issued in lawsuit No. 2024/714/769 Sales/2.
Filed by: Sheikh <orig>الشيخ</orig>/ Hamad Jaber Mubarak Al-Sabah <orig>حمد جابر مبارك الصباح</orig>.
Against: Sheikha <orig>الشيخة</orig>/ Munira Fahad Duaij Al-Salman Al-Sabah <orig>منيرة فهد دعيج السلمان الصباح</orig>.

**Property Description:** As stated in the Municipality Description Certificate <orig>شهادة أوصاف البلدية</orig>.
Property document No. 2017/4759, located in Al-Masayel <orig>المسايل</orig> area - Plot (132), Block No. (5), Plan M/37884 - with an area of 400m², by public auction with a base price of 558,000 K.D. (Five Hundred and Fifty-Eight Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
** It was reported that the property has no violations.
** And according to the expert's report:
The disputed property located in Al-Masayel <orig>المسايل</orig> area, Block 5 - Street 511 - Plot 132.
At the time of inspection, it was as follows:
1- The disputed property is a medium-built family residential plot, located on a single street with a western facade, bordered by neighbors on 3 sides. Its exterior cladding is made of stone and ceramic, and it consists of a basement, ground floor, first floor, half second floor, and a roof. It has 2 entrances: a main entrance leading to the plot and a current entrance leading to the basement.
2- The area of the disputed property is 400 square meters, which matches ownership document No. 4759 dated 29/6/2017, submitted by the plaintiff's agent at the session on 29/8/2022.

3- Those present stated that they could not enable the expert to inspect the disputed property from the inside.
4- The plaintiff's agent submitted plans for the property showing its internal components. Both parties acknowledged the accuracy of the plans and the components mentioned therein, and the plans were approved by both parties to the lawsuit.
5- After reviewing the plans, the expert <orig>خبير الدراية</orig> stated that he could estimate the property's value based on the external inspection and the submitted plans.
6- According to the submitted plans, the components of the disputed property are as follows:
- Basement: Consists of a main kitchen, (1) room, bathroom, hall, laundry room, maid's room with bathroom - driver's room with bathroom.
- Ground Floor: Consists of (3) rooms, kitchen, reception hall, (1) bathroom and washbasins.
- First Floor: Consists of a hall, (1) room, (1) bathroom, (1) master bedroom with bathroom, (2) master bedrooms with bathroom and dressing room.
- Half Second Floor: Consists of a hall, balcony, (1) master bedroom with bathroom, (1) master bedroom with bathroom and dressing room.
- The disputed property has an elevator, and the expert observed from the external inspection that the air conditioning is central.

## Second: Auction Terms:

1.  First: The auction begins with the base price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
2.  Second: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must pay the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
3.  Third: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
4.  Fourth: If the bidder whose offer was approved deposits at least one-fifth of the price, the sale will be postponed with a ten percent increase.
5.  Fifth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
6.  Sixth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid with the ten percent increase, the bidding will immediately be reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no offer not accompanied by a full deposit of its value will be considered. The defaulting bidder will be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
7.  Seventh: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
8.  Eighth: This announcement is published in accordance with the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for them, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
9.  Ninth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance (i.e., a thorough inspection).

**Notice:**
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the dispossessed owner is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees upon the conclusion of the sale session.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, otherwise the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding will be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was previously awarded to them in the preceding session. No bid in this session will be considered unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, execution procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement shall be published in accordance with the law and is requested by those directly involved in the sale procedures, at their responsibility, without the Department of Clerks <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any ignorance of its condition.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose ownership has been divested is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obliged to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent <orig>أجرة المثل</orig>."

Deputy Chief Justice of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>

Announcement
The Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig> announces the offering of the practices mentioned below.
Practice documents can be obtained electronically from the website:
.https://eprocurement.mew.gov.kw
* Offering Date: 7/9/2025
* Closing Date: 5/10/2025
* Document Price: As stated on the website and in the attached table.
* Initial Security Deposit: As stated on the website and in the attached table,
valid for 90 days in favor of the Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig> and non-refundable.
* Final Time for Submission of Bids: At 10:30 AM on
the date specified in the announcement below for depositing bids. No bid received after this time will be accepted.
* The cash equivalent mentioned on the website must be paid electronically.
* A certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage, issued by the Ministry of
Social Affairs and Labor <orig>وزارة الشئون الاجتماعية والعمل</orig>, must be attached with the bid.
* Bids must be accompanied by a certificate from the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> stating the company's registration
for the year 2025/2026.
* Documents must be placed in sealed envelopes, stamped with red wax, clearly marked with
the practice number and subject, and deposited in the bids box located in the Procurement and
Supplies Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات والتوريدات</orig> at the main building of the Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig>, South
Al-Surra <orig>السرة</orig>, Sixth Ring Road, Ground Floor.
* This announcement is considered an integral part of the practice documents.
* For additional information and other conditions, please refer to the website of
(Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig> - Procurement Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات</orig>)

# Audit Bureau <orig>ديوان المحاسبة</orig>

Announcement of Tender No. (2026-10/25)
Regarding the purchase, supply, installation, operation, and maintenance of
audio-visual equipment for the Bureau's building

<table_caption>Tender Details for Audit Bureau</table_caption>
<table>
| Submission | Closing | Price | Guarantee |
|:------|:-------|:------|:--------|

<table_caption>Public Meeting for Opening Bids</table_caption>
<table>

The Audit Bureau <orig>ديوان المحاسبة</orig> announces Tender No. (2026-10/25) in accordance with the terms and specifications contained in the tender documents, which can be obtained from the Supplies Department at the Bureau's headquarters located in (Al-Shuwaikh Administrative <orig>الشويخ الإدارية</orig> - Street 102) during official working hours. Payment is to be made via K-Net <orig>الكي نت</orig> device. Bids must include an initial security of no less than (2%) of the bid value in the form of a letter of guarantee or a certified check issued by one of the accredited local banks in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, and it must be valid for the entire duration of the bid (90) ninety days. The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Tuesday, 2025/9/30.

The following certificates must be attached with the bids:
1.  A valid 'To Whom It May Concern' certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there is no suspension on the bidder's file regarding government contracts.
2.  A valid tax payment certificate issued by the Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig>.
3.  A certificate of payment of subscriptions to the Public Institution for Social Security <orig>المؤسسة العامة للتأمينات الاجتماعية</orig>.
Otherwise, the bid will be considered void.
*   Note: Follow the official website of the Audit Bureau <orig>ديوان المحاسبة</orig> (www.sab.gov.kw) for any updates.

# National Bureau for Human Rights <orig>الديوان الوطني لحقوق الإنسان</orig>

Announcement
of Tender No. (2026-2025/2-2)

The National Bureau for Human Rights <orig>الديوان الوطني لحقوق الإنسان</orig> announces Tender No. (2025/2024-2) for the supply of a central storage unit and backup unit for the National Bureau for Human Rights <orig>الديوان الوطني لحقوق الإنسان</orig>, in accordance with the technical terms and specifications contained in the tender documents, which can be obtained from the Financial Affairs Department - Ministry of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزارة الخارجية</orig> building - in Sharq area <orig>منطقة شرق</orig> during official working hours, starting from Sunday, 2025/9/7, for a non-refundable fee of 75 K.D. <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (only seventy-five dinars).
Offers should be submitted to the National Bureau for Human Rights <orig>الديوان الوطني لحقوق الإنسان</orig> - Financial Affairs Department - Purchasing and Contracts Section at the address of the National Bureau for Human Rights <orig>الديوان الوطني لحقوق الإنسان</orig>, stating the tender number and subject as indicated above, while avoiding mentioning the bidder's name or any indication thereof. Offers must be accompanied by an initial security of no less than (2%) of the bid value in the form of a letter of guarantee or a certified check issued by one of the accredited local banks in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, and it must be valid for the entire duration of the bid (90) ninety days. The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Tuesday, 2025/9/30.

Head of the Tripartite Committee for Managing the Affairs of
the National Bureau for Human Rights <orig>الديوان الوطني لحقوق الإنسان</orig>

The envelopes designated for bids are to be received from the Tenders, Contracts, and Investment Section in the Financial Affairs Control (First Floor) - located at Jaber Al-Ahmad Youth Center <orig>مركز شباب جابر الأحمد</orig> in Jaber Al-Ahmad area <orig>منطقة جابر الأحمد</orig> - Block (7) - (N3) - Street 60, during official working hours.

Bid envelopes are to be received from the Tenders, Contracts and Investment Department in the Financial Affairs Control (First Floor) - located at Jaber Al-Ahmad Youth Center <orig>مركز شباب جابر الأحمد</orig> in Jaber Al-Ahmad area <orig>منطقة جابر الأحمد</orig> – Block (7) – (N3) – Street 60, during official working hours.

The bidder is also obligated to ensure that the bid remains valid for a period of (90) ninety days from the closing date, accompanied by the original or a copy of the receipt for purchasing the tender documents. Any bid not accompanied by the original preliminary guarantee, a valid national labor support certificate issued by the Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشؤون الاجتماعية</orig>, and a valid clearance certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> within its contents, indicating the absence of any suspension codes related to the labor registered in its file with the Authority, and a certificate of payment of subscriptions to the Public Institution for Social Security <orig>المؤسسة العامة للتأمينات</orig>, will be excluded.

Acting Director General of the Public Authority for Youth <orig>مدير عام الهيئة العامة للشباب بالتكليف</orig>

# Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>

## Announcement

Regarding the re-issuance of Purchase Order No. 9016 for tailoring official navy blue uniforms for the Authority's employees, with the Authority's logo, a work vest, and a lab coat.
The Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> announces the re-issuance of Purchase Order No. 9016 for tailoring official navy blue uniforms for the Authority's employees, with the Authority's logo, a work vest, and a lab coat.
These documents can be obtained by visiting the website bids.pai.gov.kw starting from the date of publication of this announcement.

<table_caption>Bid Details for Official Uniforms</table_caption>
<table>
| Bid No. | Closing Date | Document Price | Initial Security Deposit | Preliminary Meeting |
|:------|:---|:---|:---|:---|
| 9016 | 7/9/2025 | 75 K.D. | 1100 K.D. | None |
</table>

The deadline for submitting bids is Thursday, 11/9/2025, until 12:00 PM. Bids shall be submitted at the main headquarters of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> (Second Floor - Supplies and Stores Department - Procurement Section) in an envelope marked with the name of the practice. Bids shall be valid for (90) days from the date of opening the bid envelopes.
The bidder must submit a recent 'To Whom It May Concern' certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there is no suspension on the company's file regarding government contracts registered with the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, and a 'To Whom It May Concern' certificate confirming compliance with the national labor percentage, dated contemporaneously with the bid date. The bidder must also deposit with their bid an initial security deposit in the form of a certified check or an unconditional, unreserved, and irrevocable letter of guarantee issued in the name of the bidder by one of the accredited banks in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and in favor of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> for the duration of the bid's validity. Any bid not accompanied by the full amount of this security will be rejected. The initial security deposit may not be refunded until (90) days have passed from the closing date of the practice or when the winning bidder signs the contract, unless the practice is canceled. The Authority will not pay any interest on the amount of this security, and bidders are not permitted to seize its amount, noting that this practice is indivisible.

The Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> announces the extension of the closing period for Tender No. (2025/2026-71-T1) for licensing the provision of currency exchange services in the Departures or Arrivals Hall for Unit No. (FFM10) in Passenger Terminal No. (1) at Kuwait International Airport <orig>مطار الكويت الدولي</orig>. # Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>

## Announcement (2025 / 95)
The closing date for Tender No. 2024/2023/4, related to the design, implementation, management, and operation of the Educational, Cultural, and Recreational Center project on Abdullah Al-Ahmad Street <orig>شارع عبدالله الأحمد</orig>, is postponed.
Further to the announcement published in the Official Gazette Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> in the issue dated April 23, 2024, Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> announces the postponement of the closing date for Tender No. 2024/2023/4, related to the design, implementation, management, and operation of the Educational, Cultural, and Recreational Center project on Abdullah Al-Ahmad Street <orig>شارع عبدالله الأحمد</orig>, for a period of 6 months, making the new date March 1, 2026, corresponding to Sunday, instead of September 2, 2025.

Director General of the Municipality <orig>مدير عام البلدية</orig>

# Kuwait University <orig>جامعة الكويت</orig>

## Announcement
Kuwait University <orig>جامعة الكويت</orig> announces the re-issuance of the following tender:

<table_caption>Kuwait University Tender for Ice Cream and Juice Services</table_caption>
<table>
| No. | Description | Requesting Entity | Sale Price | Inspection Date | Preliminary Meeting | Closing Date | Initial Security Deposit Percentage |
|:---|:---|:---|:---|:---|:---|:---|:---|
| 1 | (Re-issued) Tender No. 2026-2025/2 for the utilization of a site at the College of Social Sciences - Shuwaikh - to provide juice and ice cream services - for one year - Nutrition Department - Kuwait University <orig>جامعة الكويت</orig> | Nutrition Department <orig>إدارة التغذية</orig> | 75 K.D. | September 21, 2025, 10:30 AM | September 24, 2025, 10:30 AM | September 30, 2025, 10:30 AM | 2% of the total bid value |
</table>

Tender documents can be obtained starting from Sunday, September 7, 2025, and on subsequent days during official working hours from the Procurement Department's website: https://pur.ku.edu.kw. The final deadline for submitting bids is 12:00 PM. Bids received after this deadline will not be considered. Bids will be opened in a public session.

1.  The complete bid, sealed with the company's stamp, must be submitted on a CD in (3 copies).
2.  The following documents must be submitted for each of:
    *   The original copy of the bid form and undertaking.
    *   The original sealed price quotation.
    *   The purchase receipt from the website.
    *   A copy of the valid national labor percentage certificate.
    *   The envelope designated for the tender.
    *   Documents requested by the University in the tender documents.
    *   Initial security deposit of 2% of the bid value.
3.  The bid will be disqualified if the required documents are not attached.
4.  Bids must be placed in the designated box at the Procurement Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات</orig> - Sabah Al-Salem University City <orig>مدينة صباح السالم الجامعية</orig>.

Note:
*   Tenders are to be withdrawn by companies specialized in this field, provided they are registered with the Supplier Affairs Department <orig>قسم شؤون الموردين</orig>.
*   The preliminary meeting will be held at the Nutrition Department <orig>إدارة التغذية</orig> - Sabah Al-Salem University City <orig>مدينة صباح السالم الجامعية</orig> (Al-Shaddadiya) - Administrations Building - 6th Floor - Supplier Affairs Department <orig>قسم شؤون الموردين</orig>.
*   Tender documents are to be submitted to the Supplier Affairs Department <orig>قسم شؤون الموردين</orig> at the University from 8:00 AM to 12:00 PM.
*   Administrations Building - 6th Floor.

# Announcement
## Kuwait Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء العام</orig>
### Announcement of Practice Tender
The Kuwait Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء العام</orig> announces the tender for Practice No. (2/2025/2026) for the renewal of database protection licenses for a period of 3 years for the Kuwait Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء العام</orig>.
Therefore, specialized traders in this field should refer to the Accounting Department (Cashier) at the Kuwait Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء العام</orig> in Mubarak Al-Abdullah <orig>مبارك العبد الله</orig> area, Second Floor, to obtain the special specifications for a fee of (75 K.D.) seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only – non-refundable – bringing with them the following documents:
1. A copy of the Commercial Register.
2. A copy of the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> certificate.
3. A copy of the registration receipt with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.
4. A copy of the national labor percentage fulfillment certificate for non-governmental companies issued by the Ministry of Social Affairs and Labor <orig>وزارة الشئون الاجتماعية والعمل</orig>, valid for one year with the bid.
5. A copy of the supplier registration receipt with the Kuwait Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء العام</orig>.
6. Initial insurance value of 2% of the submitted bid value.
7. Minutes of the preliminary meeting on Sunday, 14/9/2025.
8. Bids to be submitted to the Tenders and Contracts Preparation Department at the Kuwait Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء العام</orig> in Mubarak Al-Abdullah <orig>مبارك العبد الله</orig> area (West Mushrif <orig>غرب مشرف</orig>), First Floor.
Please note that the deadline for submitting offers is Thursday, 2/10/2025, at 1:00 PM, at the Tenders and Contracts Preparation Department in Mubarak Al-Abdullah <orig>مبارك العبد الله</orig> area (West Mushrif <orig>غرب مشرف</orig>), First Floor.

Director of Financial Affairs Department

# Announcement
Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> announces the preparation for Practice No. (13-2025/2026) concerning the review and auditing of the Bank's records and accounts for the fiscal year (2025/2026). Therefore, interested parties wishing to submit their bids should refer to the Bank to purchase the booklet of terms and technical specifications for the aforementioned, according to the details specified below:

**Conditions**
- The bidder must submit a technical offer and a financial offer in two sealed envelopes, one for the technical offer and the other for the financial offer, while ensuring to attach a copy of the bid on a flash drive, according to the following conditions:
  - The technical envelope must contain the following:
    - The initial insurance in the form of a guarantee letter for an amount of (1000 K.D.) one thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, "unconditional", free from any reservations, and irrevocable, issued by one of the banks approved by the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> in favor of Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>. This insurance must be valid for at least three months from the last date for receiving bids. Any bid not accompanied by the full amount of this insurance will be excluded. Initial insurance will not be refunded until (90) ninety days have passed from the closing date of the practice or when the winning practitioner submits the final insurance and signs the contract, unless the practice is canceled. Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> will not pay any interest on the amount of this insurance. The practitioner's creditors are not permitted to seize this amount.
    - General and special terms and conditions and technical data for the submitted offer.
    - Complete data on Kuwaiti <orig>كويتيين</orig> subcontractors (companies or individuals) who may be assigned part of the execution if required.
    - Any other documents or data required by the practice documents.
  - The financial envelope must contain the following:
    - The bid format approved by the bidder.
    - Price lists and quantity schedules.
    - Any other elements that may affect the financial value of the offer according to the tender conditions.
    - Any other documents or data required by the practice documents.

**For inquiries:**
- Methker@kcb.gov.kw
- A.Almojil@kcb.gov.kw

**Preliminary Meeting Date:**
- Thursday, 18/09/2025

**Deadline for Submitting Bids:**
- Bids should be addressed to Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> and deposited in the Purchasing Committee box at the Financial Department of Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> no later than 1:00 PM on Thursday, 25/09/2025.

**Note:**
- It is important to review the circulars related to the purchasing committee practices of Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>, available on the Bank's official website under the section titled "General and Special Circulars for Public Procurement System".
- All applying companies (not registered with Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>) must register through the Bank's website www.kcb.gov.kw and pay a registration fee of 20 K.D.
- All documents must be valid.
- Bid envelopes must be tightly sealed with red wax.
- The Bank reserves the right to cancel the practice without stating reasons.

# Meeting Minutes and Decisions
## Item One:
The minutes of the previous committee meeting No. (2025/94), held on 24/8/2025, were approved.

## Item Two:
The attendance of the esteemed committee members for the upcoming committee meeting No. (2025/96) was recorded, and a legal quorum for its convening was confirmed.

## Bid Examination
Bids were opened by the bid opening committees affiliated with the Supreme Purchasing Committee at the oil companies' headquarters. The special results for tenders and practices exceeding a value of (75,000 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) mentioned in the incoming reports were reviewed. The Committee discussed these reports and bid opening schedules, then referred them to the relevant companies for study and submission of necessary recommendations within 30 days from this date.
The details of the bid opening reports were as follows:

- Tender No. (RFP-2138870)
PROVISION OF SPECIALIZED / SUPPORT MANPOWER FOR PROCESS SAFETY MANAGEMENT FOR ALL GAS AREAS
Where (3) acceptable bids were received.

- Tender No. (RFQ-2147633)
BALL VALVES NK
Where (7) acceptable bids were received.

- Tender No. (RFQ-2146308)

# Kuwait Institute for Scientific Research <orig>معهد الكويت للأبحاث العلمية</orig>
## Announcement

The Kuwait Institute for Scientific Research <orig>معهد الكويت للأبحاث العلمية</orig> announces the issuance of Practice No. 66-M-2025/2026 for consultancy services for the design of a research and development building in the field of solar-powered water desalination - for a period of one year. The practice documents can be obtained from the Institute's website: http://www.kisr.edu.kw
In case of desire to participate, an amount of KWD 75/- (seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only) must be paid at the treasury.
Please note that the deadline for submitting bids is 12:00 PM on Thursday, 09/25/2025.

The priority of bids shall be arranged by dividing the financial value of each bid by the total technical points obtained, and these conditions may not be amended after the tender is issued."
- Therefore, this notification was deemed necessary.

# Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig>

## Announcement

**Invitation No. (KAC/CZ/01/2025)**
Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig> announces its desire to solicit price offers from specialized local entities for the lease of vehicles and labor (drivers), including maintenance and insurance, for a period of two years, commencing from the date specified in the work commencement order letter issued by Mr./ Director of Ground Services Department <orig>مدير دائرة الخدمات الأرضية</orig> at Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig> (or his representative).
Therefore, specialized entities in this field wishing to undertake the aforementioned works should refer to the office of Mr./ Secretary of the Tenders and Auctions Committee <orig>أمين سر لجنة المناقصات والمزايدات</orig> on the ground floor of Kuwait Airways' <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig> Head Office, located in Dajeej <orig>الضجيج</orig> area next to Kuwait International Airport <orig>مطار الكويت الدولي</orig>, during official working hours, starting from the date of publication of this announcement in the Official Gazette "Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>", to obtain the specified terms and technical specifications in this regard, upon payment of an amount of KD 150/- (one hundred and fifty Kuwaiti Dinars only), non-refundable. The deadline for submitting price offers (in sealed and stamped envelopes) is from 08:30 AM until 02:00 PM on Monday, 2025/10/13, at the office of Mr./ Secretary of the Tenders and Auctions Committee <orig>أمين سر لجنة المناقصات والمزايدات</orig> at Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig>. No price offers submitted after the aforementioned deadline will be accepted whatsoever. It is stipulated that the validity of the price offers must be for a period of no less than ninety (90) days, commencing from the final date specified for submitting those offers as mentioned above.
Furthermore, it should be noted that the final contract with the winning bidder will be concluded based on the contract form attached to the invitation documents, which includes all detailed terms and clauses related to this matter.
A preliminary meeting will also be held to answer inquiries from participating entities in the invitation, at 01:00 PM on Sunday, 2025/10/5, in the meeting room on the ground floor of the company's Head Office.

### Announcement No. (2025/005)

Kuwait Airways <orig>شركة الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig> announces its desire to conduct an auction for various scrap materials according to the following conditions:
- Those wishing to participate in the auction must pay a security deposit of (150 K.D.) only one hundred and fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> as an auction entry deposit on 2025/9/11 (refundable after the auction concludes).
- The security deposit must be paid at the cash desk located in the Finance Department <orig>الدائرة المالية</orig> on the ground floor of the main building of Kuwait Airways <orig>شركة الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig> in Al-Dajeej <orig>الضجيج</orig> area, along with providing us with a copy of civil IDs <orig>البطاقات المدنية</orig> to obtain the necessary security permits for auction entry.
- Bringing the original payment receipt is a condition for participating in the auction.
- In case the winner withdraws after their bid is accepted and the auction concludes, they are not entitled to claim the security deposit.
- In case the winner withdraws after their bid is accepted, they must submit a withdrawal declaration to the Assets Valuation and Sale Committee <orig>لجنة تقييم وبيع الاصول</orig>. Otherwise, they will be prevented from participating in future auctions.
- The auction requires personal attendance for those wishing to purchase.
- Bids must be submitted in a sealed envelope to Mr./Secretary of the Assets Valuation and Sale Committee <orig>امين سر لجنة تقييم وبيع الاصول</orig> immediately after the inspection concludes.
- The successful bidder, upon acceptance of their submitted bid, must pay the full bid value at the cash desk in the Finance Department <orig>الدائرة المالية</orig> on the ground floor of the main building of Kuwait Airways <orig>شركة الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig> in Al-Dajeej <orig>الضجيج</orig> area.
- The original copy of the payment receipt must be handed over to Mr./Secretary of the Assets Valuation and Sale Committee <orig>امين سر لجنة تقييم وبيع الاصول</orig> to enable the issuance of necessary security permits for receiving and transporting scrap materials.
- The successful bidder shall bear the costs of transporting and receiving scrap materials and cleaning the site.
- The buyer is obligated to remove the materials from the site within a period not exceeding (20) days from the date of paying the bid value, otherwise the auction will be withdrawn from them with a deduction of (20%) of the bid value.
